change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 226/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

reg.title: Multilateral Instrument 11-101 Principal Regulator System
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 58/2008, March 17, 2008]

definition.def: means an investment dealer, or a mutual fund dealer, as defined in NI 31-101;
means a client of a person or company if the client

paragraph.paragraphtext: was a client of the person or company immediately before the client became a resident of the local jurisdiction,
is a spouse, parent, grandparent, brother, sister or child of a person referred to in paragraph (a),
is a parent, grandparent, brother, sister or child of the spouse of a person referred to in paragraph (a),

is a person or company of which a majority of the voting securities are beneficially owned by persons or companies, or a majority of the directors are individuals, described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c), or
is a trust or estate of which all of the beneficiaries or a majority of the trustees or executors are persons or companies described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c);

definition.def: means National Instrument 31-101 National Registration System;
means, for a person or company, the jurisdiction of a non-principal regulator;
means, for a person or company, the securities regulatory authority or regulator of a jurisdiction other than the principal jurisdiction;
means, for a person or company, the jurisdiction of the principal regulator;
means, for a person or company, the securities regulatory authority or regulator determined in accordance with Part 2;
has the same meaning as in NI 31-101; and
has the same meaning as in NI 31-101.

section.subsandwich: In Qubec, nothing in this Instrument shall be construed as relieving a person or company from requirements relating to the language of documents.
For the purposes of Part 5, the principal regulator

paragraph.paragraphtext: for a person or company, other than an individual, is the securities regulatory authority or regulator of the jurisdiction in which the person or company's head office is located, and
for an individual is the securities regulatory authority or regulator of the jurisdiction in which the individual's working office is located.

section.marginalnote: Notice of principal regulator for registration

subsection.subsectiontext: As soon as practicable after relying on an exemption under Part 5, the person or company must file a completed Form 11-101F1.
Subsection (1) does not apply if the person or company is required to file a completed Form 31-101F1 or Form 31-101F2 under NI 31-101.

section.marginalnote: Notice of change of principal regulator for registration

subsection.subsectiontext: A person or company relying on Part 5 must file a completed Form 11-101F1, as soon as practicable, if,

paragraph.paragraphtext: for a person or company other than an individual, the person or company changes its head office to another principal jurisdiction, or
for an individual, the location of the individual's working office changes to another principal jurisdiction.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subsection (1) does not apply if the person or company is required to file a completed Form 31-101F2 under NI 31-101.

section.subsandwich: Despite section 2.5, if a person or company receives written notice from a securities regulatory authority or regulator that specifies a principal regulator for the person or company, the principal regulator specified in the notice is the principal regulator for the person or company as of the later of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the date the person or company receives the notice, and
the effective date specified in the notice, if any.

section.sectiontext: In this Part, in Qubec, "trade" has the same meaning as in section 1.6 of National Instrument 45-106 Prospectus and Registration Exemptions.
This Part does not apply if,

paragraph.paragraphtext: for a person or company other than an individual, the person or company's head office is located in Ontario, and
for an individual, the individual's working office is located in Ontario.

section.subsandwich: If the local jurisdiction is a non-principal jurisdiction, the registration requirement does not apply to a person or company if the person or company

paragraph.paragraphtext: is registered as a dealer in its principal jurisdiction,
is trading with or for an eligible client,
has 10 or fewer eligible clients in the local jurisdiction,
has in aggregate $10 000 000 or less in assets under management for clients referred to in paragraph (c), and
complies with section 5.7.

section.subsandwich: If the local jurisdiction is a non-principal jurisdiction, the registration requirement does not apply to a person or company if the person or company

paragraph.paragraphtext: is registered as an unrestricted adviser in its principal jurisdiction,
is advising an eligible client,
has 10 or fewer eligible clients in the local jurisdiction,
has in aggregate $10 000 000 or less in assets under management for clients referred to in paragraph (c), and
complies with section 5.7.

section.subsandwich: If the local jurisdiction is a non-principal jurisdiction, the registration requirement does not apply to an individual if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the individual is registered in its principal jurisdiction to trade on behalf of a dealer,
the dealer is registered in its principal jurisdiction,
in the local jurisdiction, the individual is trading with or on behalf of 5 or fewer eligible clients of the dealer,
the dealer has in aggregate $5 000 000 or less in assets under management for clients referred to in paragraph (c), and
the individual complies with section 5.7.

section.subsandwich: If the local jurisdiction is a non-principal jurisdiction, the registration requirement does not apply to an individual if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the individual is registered in its principal jurisdiction to advise on behalf of an unrestricted adviser,
the unrestricted adviser is registered in its principal jurisdiction,
in the local jurisdiction, the individual is advising 5 or fewer eligible clients of the unrestricted adviser,
the unrestricted adviser has in aggregate $5 000 000 or less in assets under management for clients referred to in paragraph (c), and
the individual complies with section 5.7.

section.subsandwich: For the purposes of paragraphs 5.3 (e), 5.4 (e), 5.5 (e) and 5.6 (e), the person or company must

paragraph.paragraphtext: disclose to the eligible clients in the local jurisdiction, before it relies on an exemption in Part 5, that the person or company

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: is exempt from the registration requirement in the local jurisdiction, and
is not subject to requirements otherwise applicable under local securities legislation,

paragraph.paragraphtext: act fairly, honestly and in good faith in the course of its dealings with the eligible clients, and

not advertise for or solicit new clients in the local jurisdiction, except for advertising for or soliciting new clients for trades made in reliance on another registration exemption in the local jurisdiction.

section.subsandwich: A person or company must, before relying on section 5.3, 5.4, 5.5 or 5.6, give written notice of the exemption that it intends to rely on to the securities regulatory authority in the local jurisdiction.
This Instrument takes effect on September 19, 2005.

centertext.strong:
Notice of Principal Regulator
under Multilateral Instrument 11-101

section.subsandwich: If this notice is being filed for a change in the person or company's principal regulator, provide the details of the basis for the change in principal regulator.

content.provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Securities Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 418, section 184 and Securities Act, S.B.C. 2004, c. 43, section 170]
